arabic_text: الٓرۚ تِلۡكَ ءَايَٰتُ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ وَقُرۡءَانٖ مُّبِينٖ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [668]- See footnote to 2:1.

translations.english_saheeh: Alif, Lām, Rā.[668] These are the verses of the Book and a clear Qur’ān [i.e., recitation].
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. Alif-Lâm-Râ. [These letters are one of the miracles of the Qur’ân, and none but Allâh (Alone) knows their meanings].These are Verses of the Book and a plain Qur’ân.
translations.english_rwwad: Alif Lām Ra. These are the verses of the Book and a clear Qur’an.

arabic_text: رُّبَمَا يَوَدُّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لَوۡ كَانُواْ مُسۡلِمِينَ
phonetic: 15.2 Rubamā Yawaddu Al-Ladhīna Kafarū Law Kānū Muslimīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [669]- On the Day of Judgement or at the time of death.

translations.english_saheeh: Perhaps those who disbelieve will wish[669] that they had been Muslims.
translations.english_hilali_khan: How much would those who disbelieved wish that they had been Muslims [those who have submitted themselves to Allâh’s Will in Islâm i.e. Islâmic Monotheism - this will be on the Day of Resurrection when they will see the disbelievers going to Hell and the Muslims going to Paradise].[1]
translations.english_rwwad: There will come a time that the disbelievers will wish that they were Muslims.

arabic_text: ذَرۡهُمۡ يَأۡكُلُواْ وَيَتَمَتَّعُواْ وَيُلۡهِهِمُ ٱلۡأَمَلُۖ فَسَوۡفَ يَعۡلَمُونَ
phonetic: 15.3 Dharhum Ya'kulū Wa Yatamatta`ū Wa Yulhihimu Al-'Amalu Fasawfa Ya`lamūna

translations.english_saheeh: Let them eat and enjoy themselves and be diverted by [false] hope, for they are going to know.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Leave them to eat and enjoy, and let them be preoccupied with (false) hope. They will come to know!
translations.english_rwwad: Let them eat and enjoy themselves and be diverted with false hope; they will come to know.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَهۡلَكۡنَا مِن قَرۡيَةٍ إِلَّا وَلَهَا كِتَابٞ مَّعۡلُومٞ
phonetic: 15.4 Wa Mā 'Ahlaknā Min Qaryatin 'Illā Wa Lahā Kitābun Ma`lūmun

translations.english_saheeh: And We did not destroy any city but that for it was a known decree.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And never did We destroy a township but there was a known decree for it.
translations.english_rwwad: We never destroyed any town except that it had a destined time.

arabic_text: مَّا تَسۡبِقُ مِنۡ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَهَا وَمَا يَسۡتَـٔۡخِرُونَ
phonetic: 15.5 Mā Tasbiqu Min 'Ummatin 'Ajalahā Wa Mā Yasta'khirūna

translations.english_saheeh: No nation will precede its term, nor will they remain thereafter.
translations.english_hilali_khan: No nation can advance its term, nor delay it.
translations.english_rwwad: No nation can advance its appointed time, nor can they delay it.

arabic_text: وَقَالُواْ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِي نُزِّلَ عَلَيۡهِ ٱلذِّكۡرُ إِنَّكَ لَمَجۡنُونٞ
phonetic: 15.6 Wa Qālū Yā 'Ayyuhā Al-Ladhī Nuzzila `Alayhi Adh-Dhikru 'Innaka Lamajnūnun

footnotes.english_saheeh: [670]- Literally, "possessed by jinn."

translations.english_saheeh: And they say, "O you upon whom the message has been sent down, indeed you are mad.[670]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they say: "O you (Muhammad صلى الله عليه و سلم) to whom the Dhikr (the Qur’ân) has been sent down! Verily, you are a mad man!
translations.english_rwwad: They say, “O you to whom the Reminder has been sent down, You are surely insane!

arabic_text: لَّوۡمَا تَأۡتِينَا بِٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
phonetic: 15.7 Law Mā Ta'tīnā Bil-Malā'ikati 'In Kunta Mina Aş-Şādiqīna

translations.english_saheeh: Why do you not bring us the angels, if you should be among the truthful?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Why do you not bring angels to us if you are of the truthful?"
translations.english_rwwad: Why do you not bring us the angels, if you are truthful?”

arabic_text: مَا نُنَزِّلُ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةَ إِلَّا بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَمَا كَانُوٓاْ إِذٗا مُّنظَرِينَ
phonetic: 15.8 Mā Nunazzilu Al-Malā'ikata 'Illā Bil-Ĥaqqi Wa Mā Kānū 'Idhāan Munžarīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [671]- i.e., with a message or, as the conclusion of the verse suggests, to carry out a promised punishment.

translations.english_saheeh: We do not send down the angels except with truth;[671] and they [i.e., the disbelievers] would not then be reprieved.
translations.english_hilali_khan: We send not the angels down except with the truth (i.e. for torment), and in that case, they (the disbelievers) would have no respite!
translations.english_rwwad: We do not send down the angels except for a just cause, and then they [the disbelievers] would be granted no respite.

arabic_text: إِنَّا نَحۡنُ نَزَّلۡنَا ٱلذِّكۡرَ وَإِنَّا لَهُۥ لَحَٰفِظُونَ
phonetic: 15.9 'Innā Naĥnu Nazzalnā Adh-Dhikra Wa 'Innā Lahu Laĥāfižūna

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.15:9) This Verse is a challenge to mankind and everyone is obliged to believe in the miracles of this Qur’ân. It is a clear fact that more than 1400 years have elapsed and not a single word of this Qur’ân has been changed, although the disbelievers tried their utmost to change it in every way, but they failed miserably in their efforts. As it is mentioned in this holy Verse: "We will guard it." By Allâh! He has guarded it. On the contrary, all the other holy Books [the Taurât (Torah), the Injeel (Gospel).] have been corrupted in the form of additions or subtractions or alterations in the original text.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, it is We who sent down the message [i.e., the Qur’ān], and indeed, We will be its guardian.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, We, it is We Who have sent down the Dhikr (i.e. the Qur’ân) and surely, We will guard it (from corruption)[2].
translations.english_rwwad: It is We Who have sent down the Reminder, and it is We Who will preserve it.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا مِن قَبۡلِكَ فِي شِيَعِ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ
phonetic: 15.10 Wa Laqad 'Arsalnā Min Qablika Fī Shiya`i Al-'Awwalīna

translations.english_saheeh: And We had certainly sent [messengers] before you, [O Muḥammad], among the sects of the former peoples.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Indeed, We sent (Messengers) before you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه و سلم) amongst the sects (communities) of old.
translations.english_rwwad: We did send messengers before you among the factions of early peoples.

arabic_text: وَمَا يَأۡتِيهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ يَسۡتَهۡزِءُونَ
phonetic: 15.11 Wa Mā Ya'tīhim Min Rasūlin 'Illā Kānū Bihi Yastahzi'ūna

translations.english_saheeh: And no messenger would come to them except that they ridiculed him.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And never came a Messenger to them but they did mock at him.
translations.english_rwwad: No messenger came to them except that they ridiculed him.

arabic_text: كَذَٰلِكَ نَسۡلُكُهُۥ فِي قُلُوبِ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: Thus do We insert it [i.e., denial] into the hearts of the criminals.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Thus do We let it (polytheism and disbelief) enter the hearts of the Mujrimûn [criminals, polytheists and pagans (because of their mocking at the Messengers)].
translations.english_rwwad: This is how We let this [denial] enter the hearts of the wicked.

arabic_text: لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِهِۦ وَقَدۡ خَلَتۡ سُنَّةُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ
phonetic: 15.13 Lā Yu'uminūna Bihi Wa Qad Khalat Sunnatu Al-'Awwalīna

translations.english_saheeh: They will not believe in it, while there has already occurred the precedent of the former peoples.
translations.english_hilali_khan: They would not believe in it (the Qur’ân); and already the example of (Allâh’s punishment of) the ancients (who disbelieved) has gone forth.
translations.english_rwwad: They will not believe in it, although the examples of the earlier people is well established.

arabic_text: وَلَوۡ فَتَحۡنَا عَلَيۡهِم بَابٗا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَظَلُّواْ فِيهِ يَعۡرُجُونَ
phonetic: 15.14 Wa Law Fataĥnā `Alayhim Bābāan Mina As-Samā'i Fažallū Fīhi Ya`rujūna

translations.english_saheeh: And [even] if We opened to them a gate from the heaven and they continued therein to ascend,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And even if We opened to them a gate from the heaven and they were to keep on ascending thereto (all the day long)
translations.english_rwwad: Even if We were to open for them a gateway to the heaven, through which they kept ascending,

arabic_text: لَقَالُوٓاْ إِنَّمَا سُكِّرَتۡ أَبۡصَٰرُنَا بَلۡ نَحۡنُ قَوۡمٞ مَّسۡحُورُونَ
phonetic: 15.15 Laqālū 'Innamā Sukkirat 'Abşārunā Bal Naĥnu Qawmun Masĥūrūna

translations.english_saheeh: They would say, "Our eyes have only been dazzled. Rather, we are a people affected by magic."
translations.english_hilali_khan: They would surely say (in the evening): "Our eyes have been (as if) dazzled (we have not seen any angel or heaven). Nay, we are a people bewitched."
translations.english_rwwad: they would still say, “Our eyes have been dazzled; rather, we have been bewitched.”

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ جَعَلۡنَا فِي ٱلسَّمَآءِ بُرُوجٗا وَزَيَّنَّٰهَا لِلنَّٰظِرِينَ
phonetic: 15.16 Wa Laqad Ja`alnā Fī As-Samā'i Burūjāan Wa Zayyannāhā Lilnnāžirīna

translations.english_saheeh: And We have placed within the heaven great stars and have beautified it for the observers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed, We have put the big stars in the heaven and We beautified it for the beholders.[1]
translations.english_rwwad: We have placed constellations in the heaven and adorned it for the onlookers,

arabic_text: وَحَفِظۡنَٰهَا مِن كُلِّ شَيۡطَٰنٖ رَّجِيمٍ
phonetic: 15.17 Wa Ĥafižnāhā Min Kulli Shayţānin Rajīmin

translations.english_saheeh: And We have protected it from every devil expelled [from the mercy of Allāh]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We have guarded it (near heaven) from every outcast Shaitân (devil).
translations.english_rwwad: and We have guarded it from every accursed devil,

arabic_text: إِلَّا مَنِ ٱسۡتَرَقَ ٱلسَّمۡعَ فَأَتۡبَعَهُۥ شِهَابٞ مُّبِينٞ
phonetic: 15.18 'Illā Mani Astaraqa As-Sam`a Fa'atba`ahu Shihābun Mubīnun

translations.english_saheeh: Except one who steals a hearing and is pursued by a clear burning flame.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Except him (devil) who steals the hearing then he is pursued by a clear flaming fire.
translations.english_rwwad: except the one who manages to eavesdrop, he will then be pursued by a visible burning flame.

arabic_text: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ مَدَدۡنَٰهَا وَأَلۡقَيۡنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِيَ وَأَنۢبَتۡنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ مَّوۡزُونٖ
phonetic: 15.19 Wa Al-'Arđa Madadnāhā Wa 'Alqaynā Fīhā Rawāsiya Wa 'Anbatnā Fīhā Min Kulli Shay'in Mawzūnin

translations.english_saheeh: And the earth - We have spread it and cast therein firmly set mountains and caused to grow therein [something] of every well-balanced thing.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the earth We have spread out, and have placed therein firm mountains, and caused to grow therein all kinds of things in due proportion.
translations.english_rwwad: As for the earth, We have spread it out and placed therein firm mountains, and caused to grow therein everything in due proportion.

arabic_text: وَجَعَلۡنَا لَكُمۡ فِيهَا مَعَٰيِشَ وَمَن لَّسۡتُمۡ لَهُۥ بِرَٰزِقِينَ
phonetic: 15.20 Wa Ja`alnā Lakum Fīhā Ma`āyisha Wa Man Lastum Lahu Birāziqīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [672]- Allāh has put at your service other men and animals for which He provides.  An additional meaning is that Allāh provides means for your living and for all other creatures as well.

translations.english_saheeh: And We have made for you therein means of living and [for] those for whom you are not providers.[672]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We have provided therein means of living, for you and for those whom you provide not [moving (living) creatures, cattle, beasts, and other animals].
translations.english_rwwad: And We have made therein for you means of sustenance and for those whom you do not provide.

arabic_text: وَإِن مِّن شَيۡءٍ إِلَّا عِندَنَا خَزَآئِنُهُۥ وَمَا نُنَزِّلُهُۥٓ إِلَّا بِقَدَرٖ مَّعۡلُومٖ
phonetic: 15.21 Wa 'In Min Shay'in 'Illā `Indanā Khazā'inuhu Wa Mā Nunazziluhu 'Illā Biqadarin Ma`lūmin

translations.english_saheeh: And there is not a thing but that with Us are its depositories, and We do not send it down except according to a known [i.e., specified] measure.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And there is not a thing, but with Us are the stores thereof. And We send it not down except in a known measure.
translations.english_rwwad: There is nothing except that We have its treasuries, and We do not send it down except in a determined measure.

arabic_text: وَأَرۡسَلۡنَا ٱلرِّيَٰحَ لَوَٰقِحَ فَأَنزَلۡنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءٗ فَأَسۡقَيۡنَٰكُمُوهُ وَمَآ أَنتُمۡ لَهُۥ بِخَٰزِنِينَ
phonetic: 15.22 Wa 'Arsalnā Ar-Riyāĥa Lawāqiĥa Fa'anzalnā Mina As-Samā'i Mā'an Fa'asqaynākumūhu Wa Mā 'Antum Lahu Bikhāzinīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [673]- Causing precipitation in rainclouds or carrying pollen.  Another meaning is "pregnant winds," i.e., those carrying rainclouds.

translations.english_saheeh: And We have sent the fertilizing winds[673] and sent down water from the sky and given you drink from it. And you are not its retainers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We send the winds fertilizing (to fill heavily the clouds with water), then cause the water (rain) to descend from the sky, and We give it to you to drink, and it is not you who are the owners of its stores [i.e. to give water to whom you like or to withhold it from whom you like].
translations.english_rwwad: And We send fertilizing winds, and send down rain from the sky for you to drink, and it is not you who could store it.

arabic_text: وَإِنَّا لَنَحۡنُ نُحۡيِۦ وَنُمِيتُ وَنَحۡنُ ٱلۡوَٰرِثُونَ
phonetic: 15.23 Wa 'Innā Lanaĥnu Nuĥyī Wa Numītu Wa Naĥnu Al-Wārithūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [674]- Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) remains after all creation has passed away.
footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.15:23) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said: "When a person is dead, his deeds cease (are stopped) except three:
a) Deeds of continuous Sadaqah (act of charity), e.g. an orphan home or a well for giving water to drink.
b) (Written) knowledge with which mankind gets benefit.
c) A righteous, pious son (or daughter) who begs Allâh to forgive his (or her) parents."
(Sahih Muslim, The Book of Wasâyâ (Wills and Testaments).

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and We are the Inheritor.[674]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And certainly We! We it is Who give life, and cause death,[2] and We are the Inheritors.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, it is We Who give life and cause death, and We are the Inheritors [of all things].

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ عَلِمۡنَا ٱلۡمُسۡتَقۡدِمِينَ مِنكُمۡ وَلَقَدۡ عَلِمۡنَا ٱلۡمُسۡتَـٔۡخِرِينَ
phonetic: 15.24 Wa Laqad `Alimnā Al-Mustaqdimīna Minkum Wa Laqad `Alimnā Al-Musta'khirīna

translations.english_saheeh: And We have already known the preceding [generations] among you, and We have already known the later [ones to come].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed, We know the first generations of you who had passed away, and indeed, We know the present generations of you (mankind), and also those who will come afterwards.
translations.english_rwwad: We surely know those of you who have gone before and those who are yet to come.

arabic_text: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ يَحۡشُرُهُمۡۚ إِنَّهُۥ حَكِيمٌ عَلِيمٞ

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, your Lord will gather them; indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily, your Lord will gather them together. Truly, He is All-Wise, All-Knowing.
translations.english_rwwad: It is your Lord Who will gather them together. He is All-Wise, All-Knowing.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِن صَلۡصَٰلٖ مِّنۡ حَمَإٖ مَّسۡنُونٖ
phonetic: 15.26 Wa Laqad Khalaqnā Al-'Insāna Min Şalşālin Min Ĥama'iin Masnūnin

translations.english_saheeh: And We did certainly create man out of clay from an altered black mud.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed, We created man from dried (sounding) clay of altered mud.
translations.english_rwwad: We have created man from sounding clay, made of aging mud.

arabic_text: وَٱلۡجَآنَّ خَلَقۡنَٰهُ مِن قَبۡلُ مِن نَّارِ ٱلسَّمُومِ
phonetic: 15.27 Wa Al-Jānna Khalaqnāhu Min Qablu Min Nāri As-Samūmi

translations.english_saheeh: And the jinn We created before from scorching fire.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the jinn, We created aforetime from the smokeless flame of fire.
translations.english_rwwad: And the jinn We created before that, from smokeless fire.

arabic_text: وَإِذۡ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةِ إِنِّي خَٰلِقُۢ بَشَرٗا مِّن صَلۡصَٰلٖ مِّنۡ حَمَإٖ مَّسۡنُونٖ
phonetic: 15.28 Wa 'Idh Qāla Rabbuka Lilmalā'ikati 'Innī Khāliqun Basharāan Min Şalşālin Min Ĥama'iin Masnūnin

translations.english_saheeh: And [mention, O Muḥammad], when your Lord said to the angels, "I will create a human being out of clay from an altered black mud.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And (remember) when your Lord said to the angels: "I am going to create a man (Adam) from dried (sounding) clay of altered mud.
translations.english_rwwad: And [remember] when your Lord said to the angels, “I am going to create a human being from sounding clay, made of aging mud.

arabic_text: فَإِذَا سَوَّيۡتُهُۥ وَنَفَخۡتُ فِيهِ مِن رُّوحِي فَقَعُواْ لَهُۥ سَٰجِدِينَ
phonetic: 15.29 Fa'idhā Sawwaytuhu Wa Nafakhtu Fīhi Min Rūĥī Faqa`ū Lahu Sājidīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [675]- The element of life and soul which Allāh created for that body, not His own spirit or part of Himself (as some mistakenly believe).

translations.english_saheeh: And when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul,[675] then fall down to him in prostration."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "So, when I have fashioned him completely and breathed into him (Adam) the soul which I created for him, then fall (you) down prostrating yourselves unto him."
translations.english_rwwad: When I have shaped him and breathed into him of My [created] soul, then fall down before him in prostration.”

arabic_text: فَسَجَدَ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ كُلُّهُمۡ أَجۡمَعُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely,
translations.english_hilali_khan: So the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together.
translations.english_rwwad: Thereupon, all of the angels fell down in prostration,

arabic_text: إِلَّآ إِبۡلِيسَ أَبَىٰٓ أَن يَكُونَ مَعَ ٱلسَّٰجِدِينَ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [676]- Who was of the jinn.  See 18:50.

translations.english_saheeh: Except Iblees;[676] he refused to be with those who prostrated.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Except Iblîs (Satan) - he refused to be among the prostrators.
translations.english_rwwad: except Iblīs, who refused to be with those who prostrated.

arabic_text: قَالَ يَٰٓإِبۡلِيسُ مَا لَكَ أَلَّا تَكُونَ مَعَ ٱلسَّٰجِدِينَ
phonetic: 15.32 Qāla Yā 'Iblīsu Mā Laka 'Allā Takūna Ma`a As-Sājidīna

translations.english_saheeh: [Allāh] said, "O Iblees, what is [the matter] with you that you are not with those who prostrate?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Allâh) said: "O Iblîs (Satan)! What is your reason for not being among the prostrators?"
translations.english_rwwad: Allah said, “O Iblīs, what is the matter with you that you were not with those who prostrated?”

arabic_text: قَالَ لَمۡ أَكُن لِّأَسۡجُدَ لِبَشَرٍ خَلَقۡتَهُۥ مِن صَلۡصَٰلٖ مِّنۡ حَمَإٖ مَّسۡنُونٖ
phonetic: 15.33 Qāla Lam 'Akun Li'sjuda Libasharin Khalaqtahu Min Şalşālin Min Ĥama'iin Masnūnin

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "Never would I prostrate to a human whom You created out of clay from an altered black mud."
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Iblîs (Satan)] said: "I am not the one to prostrate myself to a human being, whom You created from dried (sounding) clay of altered mud."
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “I am not such to prostrate before a human whom You created from sounding clay, made of aging mud.”

arabic_text: قَالَ فَٱخۡرُجۡ مِنۡهَا فَإِنَّكَ رَجِيمٞ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [677]- Your position in the heavens.

translations.english_saheeh: [Allāh] said, "Then depart from it,[677] for indeed, you are expelled.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Allâh) said: "Then, get out from here, for verily, you are Rajîm (an outcast or a cursed one)." [Tafsîr At-Tabarî]
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “Then get out of here, for you are accursed,

arabic_text: وَإِنَّ عَلَيۡكَ ٱللَّعۡنَةَ إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ ٱلدِّينِ

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, upon you is the curse until the Day of Recompense."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And verily, the curse shall be upon you till the Day of Recompense (i.e. the Day of Resurrection)."
translations.english_rwwad: and the curse will be upon you until the Day of Judgment.”

arabic_text: قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرۡنِيٓ إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ يُبۡعَثُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Iblîs (Satan)] said: "O my Lord! Give me then respite till the Day they (the dead) will be resurrected."
translations.english_rwwad: Iblīs said, “My Lord, then grant me respite until the Day they are resurrected.”

arabic_text: قَالَ فَإِنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُنظَرِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: [Allāh] said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved
translations.english_hilali_khan: Allâh said: "Then, verily, you are of those reprieved,
translations.english_rwwad: Allah said, “You are of those who are granted respite,

arabic_text: إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ ٱلۡوَقۡتِ ٱلۡمَعۡلُومِ

translations.english_saheeh: Until the Day of the time well-known."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Till the Day of the time appointed."
translations.english_rwwad: until the Day of the Appointed Time.”

arabic_text: قَالَ رَبِّ بِمَآ أَغۡوَيۡتَنِي لَأُزَيِّنَنَّ لَهُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَأُغۡوِيَنَّهُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ
phonetic: 15.39 Qāla Rabbi Bimā 'Aghwaytanī La'uzayyinanna Lahum Fī Al-'Arđi Wa La'ughwiyannahum 'Ajma`īna

translations.english_saheeh: [Iblees] said, "My Lord, because You have put me in error, I will surely make [disobedience] attractive to them [i.e., mankind] on earth, and I will mislead them all
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Iblîs (Satan)] said: "O my Lord! Because you misled me, I shall indeed adorn the path of error for them (mankind) on the earth, and I shall mislead them all.
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “My Lord, since You have sent me astray, I will surely make [sins] alluring to them on earth and mislead them all,

arabic_text: إِلَّا عِبَادَكَ مِنۡهُمُ ٱلۡمُخۡلَصِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: Except, among them, Your chosen servants."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Except Your chosen, (guided) slaves among them."
translations.english_rwwad: except Your chosen slaves among them.”

arabic_text: قَالَ هَٰذَا صِرَٰطٌ عَلَيَّ مُسۡتَقِيمٌ

translations.english_saheeh: [Allāh] said, "This is a path [of return] to Me [that is] straight.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Allâh) said: "This is the Way which will lead straight to Me."
translations.english_rwwad: Allah said, “This is a straight path leading to Me.

arabic_text: إِنَّ عِبَادِي لَيۡسَ لَكَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ سُلۡطَٰنٌ إِلَّا مَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلۡغَاوِينَ
phonetic: 15.42 'Inna `Ibādī Laysa Laka `Alayhim Sulţānun 'Illā Mani Attaba`aka Mina Al-Ghāwīna

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, My servants - no authority will you have over them, except those who follow you of the deviators.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Certainly, you shall have no authority over My slaves, except those who follow you of the Ghâwûn (Mushrikûn and those who go astray, criminals, polytheists, and evil-doers).
translations.english_rwwad: You will have no authority over My slaves, except the deviants who follow you.

arabic_text: وَإِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ لَمَوۡعِدُهُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, Hell is the promised place for them all.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And surely, Hell is the promised place for them all.
translations.english_rwwad: And Hell is certainly the promised place for them, all together.

arabic_text: لَهَا سَبۡعَةُ أَبۡوَٰبٖ لِّكُلِّ بَابٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ جُزۡءٞ مَّقۡسُومٌ
phonetic: 15.44 Lahā Sab`atu 'Abwābin Likulli Bābin Minhum Juz'un Maqsūmun

translations.english_saheeh: It has seven gates; for every gate is of them [i.e., Satan's followers] a portion designated."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "It (Hell) has seven gates, for each of those gates is a (special) class (of sinners) assigned.
translations.english_rwwad: It has seven gates; each gate will have its allotted share of them.”

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَعُيُونٍ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, the righteous will be within gardens and springs,
translations.english_hilali_khan: will be amidst Gardens and water-springs (Paradise).
translations.english_rwwad: The righteous will be in gardens and springs.

arabic_text: ٱدۡخُلُوهَا بِسَلَٰمٍ ءَامِنِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: [Having been told], "Enter it in peace, safe [and secure]."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "(It will be said to them): ‘Enter therein (Paradise), in peace and security.’
translations.english_rwwad: “Enter in peace and safety!”

arabic_text: وَنَزَعۡنَا مَا فِي صُدُورِهِم مِّنۡ غِلٍّ إِخۡوَٰنًا عَلَىٰ سُرُرٖ مُّتَقَٰبِلِينَ
phonetic: 15.47 Wa Naza`nā Mā Fī Şudūrihim Min Ghillin 'Ikhwānāan `Alá Sururin Mutaqābilīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [678]- See footnote to 7:43.

translations.english_saheeh: And We will remove whatever is in their breasts of resentment,[678] [so they will be] brothers, on thrones facing each other.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And We shall remove from their breasts any deep feeling of bitterness (that they may have). (So they will be like) brothers facing each other on thrones.
translations.english_rwwad: We will remove all ill feelings from their hearts; like brothers, seated on couches facing one another.

arabic_text: لَا يَمَسُّهُمۡ فِيهَا نَصَبٞ وَمَا هُم مِّنۡهَا بِمُخۡرَجِينَ
phonetic: 15.48 Lā Yamassuhum Fīhā Naşabun Wa Mā Hum Minhā Bimukhrajīna

translations.english_saheeh: No fatigue will touch them therein, nor from it will they [ever] be removed.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "No sense of fatigue shall touch them, nor shall they (ever) be asked to leave it."
translations.english_rwwad: No fatigue will ever touch them therein, nor will they ever be made to leave.

arabic_text: ۞ نَبِّئۡ عِبَادِيٓ أَنِّيٓ أَنَا ٱلۡغَفُورُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ

translations.english_saheeh: [O Muḥammad], inform My servants that it is I who am the Forgiving, the Merciful,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Declare (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه و سلم) unto My slaves, that truly, I am the Oft-Forgiving, the Most-Merciful.
translations.english_rwwad: Inform My slaves that I am indeed the All-Forgiving, the Most Merciful,

arabic_text: وَأَنَّ عَذَابِي هُوَ ٱلۡعَذَابُ ٱلۡأَلِيمُ

translations.english_saheeh: And that it is My punishment which is the painful punishment.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And that My Torment is indeed the most painful torment.
translations.english_rwwad: and that My punishment is the most painful punishment.

arabic_text: وَنَبِّئۡهُمۡ عَن ضَيۡفِ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ

translations.english_saheeh: And inform them about the guests of Abraham,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And tell them about the guests (the angels) of Ibrâhîm (Abraham).
translations.english_rwwad: And inform them about the guests of Abraham.

arabic_text: إِذۡ دَخَلُواْ عَلَيۡهِ فَقَالُواْ سَلَٰمٗا قَالَ إِنَّا مِنكُمۡ وَجِلُونَ
phonetic: 15.52 'Idh Dakhalū `Alayhi Faqālū Salāmāan Qāla 'Innā Minkum Wajilūna

translations.english_saheeh: When they entered upon him and said, "Peace." [Abraham] said, "Indeed, we are fearful [i.e., apprehensive] of you."
translations.english_hilali_khan: When they entered unto him, and said: Salâm (peace)! [Ibrâhîm (Abraham)] said: "Indeed! We are afraid of you."
translations.english_rwwad: When they entered upon him and said, “Peace!” He said, “We are afraid of you.”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ لَا تَوۡجَلۡ إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلَٰمٍ عَلِيمٖ

translations.english_saheeh: [The angels] said, "Fear not. Indeed, we give you good tidings of a learned boy."
translations.english_hilali_khan: They (the angels) said: "Do not be afraid! We give you glad tidings of a boy (son) possessing much knowledge and wisdom."
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “Do not be afraid; We give you glad tidings of a knowledgeable boy.”

arabic_text: قَالَ أَبَشَّرۡتُمُونِي عَلَىٰٓ أَن مَّسَّنِيَ ٱلۡكِبَرُ فَبِمَ تُبَشِّرُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "Have you given me good tidings although old age has come upon me? Then of what [wonder] do you inform?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Ibrâhîm (Abraham)] said: "Do you give me glad tidings (of a son) when old age has overtaken me? Of what then is your news?"
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “Do you give me glad tidings despite my old age? What glad tidings are you giving me?”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ بَشَّرۡنَٰكَ بِٱلۡحَقِّ فَلَا تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلۡقَٰنِطِينَ
phonetic: 15.55 Qālū Basharnāka Bil-Ĥaqqi Falā Takun Mina Al-Qāniţīna

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "We have given you good tidings in truth, so do not be of the despairing."
translations.english_hilali_khan: They (the angels) said: "We give you glad tidings in truth. So be not of the despairing."
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “We have given you glad tidings in truth, so do not be of those who despair.”

arabic_text: قَالَ وَمَن يَقۡنَطُ مِن رَّحۡمَةِ رَبِّهِۦٓ إِلَّا ٱلضَّآلُّونَ
phonetic: 15.56 Qāla Wa Man Yaqnaţu Min Raĥmati Rabbihi 'Illā Ađ-Đāllūna

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord except for those astray?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Ibrâhîm (Abraham)] said: "And who despairs of the Mercy of his Lord except those who are astray?"
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “Who would despair of his Lord’s mercy except those who are misguided?”

arabic_text: قَالَ فَمَا خَطۡبُكُمۡ أَيُّهَا ٱلۡمُرۡسَلُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Ibrâhîm (Abraham) again] said: "What then is the business on which you have come, O Messengers?"
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “So, what is your mission, O messengers?”

arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّآ أُرۡسِلۡنَآ إِلَىٰ قَوۡمٖ مُّجۡرِمِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals,
translations.english_hilali_khan: They (the angels) said: "We have been sent to a people who are Mujrimûn (criminals, disbelievers, polytheists, sinners).
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “We have been sent to a wicked people,

arabic_text: إِلَّآ ءَالَ لُوطٍ إِنَّا لَمُنَجُّوهُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: Except the family of Lot; indeed, we will save them all
translations.english_hilali_khan: "(All) except the family of Lût (Lot). Them all we are surely going to save (from destruction).
translations.english_rwwad: except the household of Lot; we will surely save them all,

arabic_text: إِلَّا ٱمۡرَأَتَهُۥ قَدَّرۡنَآ إِنَّهَا لَمِنَ ٱلۡغَٰبِرِينَ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [679]- For having collaborated with the evildoers.

translations.english_saheeh: Except his wife." We [i.e., Allāh] decreed that she is of those who remain behind.[679]
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Except his wife, of whom We have decreed that she shall be of those who remain behind (i.e. she will be destroyed)."
translations.english_rwwad: except his wife; We have decreed that she will be among those who stay behind.”

arabic_text: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ءَالَ لُوطٍ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: And when the messengers came to the family of Lot,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then, when the Messengers (the angels) came unto the family of Lût (Lot).
translations.english_rwwad: When the messengers came to the household of Lot,

arabic_text: قَالَ إِنَّكُمۡ قَوۡمٞ مُّنكَرُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "Indeed, you are people unknown."
translations.english_hilali_khan: He said: "Verily! You are people unknown to me."
translations.english_rwwad: he said, “You are an unfamiliar people.”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ بَلۡ جِئۡنَٰكَ بِمَا كَانُواْ فِيهِ يَمۡتَرُونَ
phonetic: 15.63 Qālū Bal Ji'nāka Bimā Kānū Fīhi Yamtarūna

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "But we have come to you with that about which they were disputing,
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "Nay, we have come to you with that (torment) which they have been doubting.
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “We have come to you with that [punishment] which they have doubted.

arabic_text: وَأَتَيۡنَٰكَ بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَإِنَّا لَصَٰدِقُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: And we have come to you with truth, and indeed, we are truthful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And we have brought you the truth (the news of the destruction of your nation) and certainly, we tell the truth.
translations.english_rwwad: We have come to you with the truth, and we are certainly truthful.

arabic_text: فَأَسۡرِ بِأَهۡلِكَ بِقِطۡعٖ مِّنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ وَٱتَّبِعۡ أَدۡبَٰرَهُمۡ وَلَا يَلۡتَفِتۡ مِنكُمۡ أَحَدٞ وَٱمۡضُواْ حَيۡثُ تُؤۡمَرُونَ
phonetic: 15.65 Fa'asri Bi'ahlika Biqiţ`in Mina Al-Layli Wa Attabi` 'Adbārahum Wa Lā Yaltafit Minkum 'Aĥadun Wa Amđū Ĥaythu Tu'umarūna

translations.english_saheeh: So set out with your family during a portion of the night and follow behind them and let not anyone among you look back and continue on to where you are commanded."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Then travel in a part of the night with your family, and you go behind them in the rear, and let no one amongst you look back, but go on to where you are ordered."
translations.english_rwwad: So travel with your household in the dark of night and go behind them; none of you should look back, and keep going to where you are commanded.”

arabic_text: وَقَضَيۡنَآ إِلَيۡهِ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡأَمۡرَ أَنَّ دَابِرَ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ مَقۡطُوعٞ مُّصۡبِحِينَ
phonetic: 15.66 Wa Qađaynā 'Ilayhi Dhālika Al-'Amra 'Anna Dābira Hā'uulā' Maqţū`un Muşbiĥīna

translations.english_saheeh: And We conveyed to him [the decree] of that matter: that those [sinners] would be eliminated by early morning.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We made known this decree to him, that the root of those (sinners) was to be cut off in the early morning.
translations.english_rwwad: We conveyed this decree to him that these [people] will be exterminated by early morning.”

arabic_text: وَجَآءَ أَهۡلُ ٱلۡمَدِينَةِ يَسۡتَبۡشِرُونَ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [680]- At the news of Lot's visitors.

translations.english_saheeh: And the people of the city came rejoicing.[680]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the inhabitants of the city came rejoicing (at the news of the young men’s arrival).
translations.english_rwwad: The people of the city came [to Lot] rejoicing.

arabic_text: قَالَ إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ ضَيۡفِي فَلَا تَفۡضَحُونِ

translations.english_saheeh: [Lot] said, "Indeed, these are my guests, so do not shame me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Lût (Lot)] said: "Verily! these are my guests, so shame me not.
translations.english_rwwad: Lot said, “These are my guests, so do not bring shame on me.

arabic_text: وَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَلَا تُخۡزُونِ
phonetic: 15.69 Wa Attaqū Allāha Wa Lā Tukhzūni

translations.english_saheeh: And fear Allāh and do not disgrace me."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And fear Allâh and disgrace me not."
translations.english_rwwad: Fear Allah and do not disgrace me.”

arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ أَوَلَمۡ نَنۡهَكَ عَنِ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "Have we not forbidden you from [protecting] people?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: They (people of the city) said: "Did we not forbid you from entertaining (or protecting) any of the ‘Âlamîn (people, foreigners and strangers from us)?"
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “Did we not forbid you from [protecting] people?”

arabic_text: قَالَ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ بَنَاتِيٓ إِن كُنتُمۡ فَٰعِلِينَ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [681]- i.e., the women of his community who were lawful for marriage.

translations.english_saheeh: [Lot] said, "These are my daughters[681] - if you would be doers [of lawful marriage]."
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Lût (Lot)] said: "These (the girls of the nation) are my daughters (to marry lawfully), if you must act (so)."
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “These are my daughters [to marry] if you must.”

arabic_text: لَعَمۡرُكَ إِنَّهُمۡ لَفِي سَكۡرَتِهِمۡ يَعۡمَهُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: By your life, [O Muḥammad], indeed they were, in their intoxication, wandering blindly.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, by your life (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه و سلم), in their wild intoxication, they were wandering blindly.
translations.english_rwwad: By your life [O prophet], they were wandering blindly in their intoxication [of lust].

arabic_text: فَأَخَذَتۡهُمُ ٱلصَّيۡحَةُ مُشۡرِقِينَ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [682]- See footnote to 11:67.

translations.english_saheeh: So the shriek[682] seized them at sunrise.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So As-Saihah (torment - awful cry) overtook them at the time of sunrise.
translations.english_rwwad: So they were seized by the blast at sunrise,

arabic_text: فَجَعَلۡنَا عَٰلِيَهَا سَافِلَهَا وَأَمۡطَرۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ حِجَارَةٗ مِّن سِجِّيلٍ
phonetic: 15.74 Faja`alnā `Āliyahā Sāfilahā Wa 'Amţarnā `Alayhim Ĥijāratan Min Sijjīlin

translations.english_saheeh: And We made the highest part [of the city] its lowest and rained upon them stones of hard clay.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We turned (the towns of Sodom in Palestine) upside down and rained down on them stones of baked clay.
translations.english_rwwad: and We turned their cities upside down and rained down on them stones of baked clay.

arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَٰتٖ لِّلۡمُتَوَسِّمِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed in that are signs for those who discern.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Surely! In this are signs for those who see (or understand or learn the lessons from the Signs of Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, there are signs in this for those who discern.

arabic_text: وَإِنَّهَا لَبِسَبِيلٖ مُّقِيمٍ

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.15:76) Please see the Book of History by Ibn Kathir (كتاب التاريخ لابن كثير).

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, they [i.e., those cities] are [situated] on an established road.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily! They (the cities) were right on the highroad (from Makkah to Syria i.e. the place where the Dead Sea is now)[1].
translations.english_rwwad: And their place is located by a known route.

arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗ لِّلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed in that is a sign for the believers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Surely! Therein is indeed a sign for the believers.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, there are signs in this for the believers.

arabic_text: وَإِن كَانَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡأَيۡكَةِ لَظَٰلِمِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: And the companions of the thicket [i.e., the people of Madyan] were [also] wrongdoers,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the Dwellers in the Wood [i.e. the people of Madyan (Midian) to whom Prophet Shu‘aib (عليه السلام) was sent by Allâh), were also Zâlimûn (polytheists and wrong-doers).
translations.english_rwwad: And the people of the Forest [Shu‘ayb] were wrongdoers.

arabic_text: فَٱنتَقَمۡنَا مِنۡهُمۡ وَإِنَّهُمَا لَبِإِمَامٖ مُّبِينٖ

translations.english_saheeh: So We took retribution from them, and indeed, both [cities] are on a clear highway.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So, We took vengeance on them. They are both on an open highway, plain to see.
translations.english_rwwad: So We punished them in retribution, and both [places] are by a clear highway.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ كَذَّبَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡحِجۡرِ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [683]- The valley of stone.

translations.english_saheeh: And certainly did the companions of al-Ḥijr[683] [i.e., the Thamūd] deny the messengers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily, the dwellers of Al-Hijr (the rocky tract) denied the Messengers.
translations.english_rwwad: Surely the people of Al-Hijr [Thamūd] also rejected the messengers.

arabic_text: وَءَاتَيۡنَٰهُمۡ ءَايَٰتِنَا فَكَانُواْ عَنۡهَا مُعۡرِضِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: And We gave them Our signs, but from them they were turning away.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We gave them Our Signs, but they were averse to them.
translations.english_rwwad: We gave them Our signs, but they kept turning away from them.

arabic_text: وَكَانُواْ يَنۡحِتُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡجِبَالِ بُيُوتًا ءَامِنِينَ
phonetic: 15.82 Wa Kānū Yanĥitūna Mina Al-Jibāli Buyūtāan 'Āminīna

translations.english_saheeh: And they used to carve from the mountains, houses, feeling secure.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they used to hew out dwellings from the mountains (feeling themselves) secure.
translations.english_rwwad: They carved houses in the mountains, feeling secure.

arabic_text: فَأَخَذَتۡهُمُ ٱلصَّيۡحَةُ مُصۡبِحِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: But the shriek seized them at early morning,
translations.english_hilali_khan: But As-Saihah (torment - awful cry) overtook them in the early morning (of the fourth day of their promised punishment days).
translations.english_rwwad: So they were seized by the blast early in the morning.

arabic_text: فَمَآ أَغۡنَىٰ عَنۡهُم مَّا كَانُواْ يَكۡسِبُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: So nothing availed them [from] what they used to earn.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And all that they used to earn availed them not.
translations.english_rwwad: Nothing of what they earned was of any avail to them.

arabic_text: وَمَا خَلَقۡنَا ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَآ إِلَّا بِٱلۡحَقِّۗ وَإِنَّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ لَأٓتِيَةٞۖ فَٱصۡفَحِ ٱلصَّفۡحَ ٱلۡجَمِيلَ
phonetic: 15.85 Wa Mā Khalaqnā As-Samāwāti Wa Al-'Arđa Wa Mā Baynahumā 'Illā Bil-Ĥaqqi Wa 'Inna As-Sā`ata La'ātiyatun Fāşfaĥi Aş-Şafĥa Al-Jamīla

translations.english_saheeh: And We have not created the heavens and earth and that between them except in truth. And indeed, the Hour is coming; so forgive with gracious forgiveness.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We created not the heavens and the earth and all that is between them except with truth, and the Hour is surely coming, so overlook (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه و سلم) their faults with gracious forgiveness. [This was before the ordainment of Jihâd - holy fighting in Allâh’s cause].
translations.english_rwwad: We have not created the heavens and earth and all that is between them except for a true purpose. The Hour is certainly coming, so bear with them graciously.

arabic_text: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ ٱلۡخَلَّٰقُ ٱلۡعَلِيمُ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, your Lord - He is the Knowing Creator.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, your Lord is the All-Knowing Creator.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, your Lord is the Absolute Creator, the All-Knowing.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ ءَاتَيۡنَٰكَ سَبۡعٗا مِّنَ ٱلۡمَثَانِي وَٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ ٱلۡعَظِيمَ
phonetic: 15.87 Wa Laqad 'Ātaynāka Sab`āan Mina Al-Mathānī Wa Al-Qur'āna Al-`Ažīma

footnotes.english_saheeh: [684]- Referring to Sūrah al-Fātiḥah.

translations.english_saheeh: And We have certainly given you, [O Muḥammad], seven of the often repeated [verses][684] and the great Qur’ān.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed, We have bestowed upon you seven of Al-Mathâni (seven repeatedly recited Verses), (i.e. Sûrat Al-Fâtihah) and the Grand Qur’ân.[2]
translations.english_rwwad: We have surely given you the seven oft-repeated verses and the great Qur’an.

arabic_text: لَا تَمُدَّنَّ عَيۡنَيۡكَ إِلَىٰ مَا مَتَّعۡنَا بِهِۦٓ أَزۡوَٰجٗا مِّنۡهُمۡ وَلَا تَحۡزَنۡ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وَٱخۡفِضۡ جَنَاحَكَ لِلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 15.88 Lā Tamuddanna `Aynayka 'Ilá Mā Matta`nā Bihi 'Azwājāan Minhum Wa Lā Taĥzan `Alayhim Wa Akhfiđ Janāĥaka Lilmu'uminīna

translations.english_saheeh: Do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [certain] categories of them [i.e., the disbelievers], and do not grieve over them. And lower your wing [i.e., show kindness] to the believers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Look not with your eyes ambitiously at what We have bestowed on certain classes of them (the disbelievers), nor grieve over them. And lower your wings for the believers (be courteous to the fellow-believers).
translations.english_rwwad: Do not look longingly at the pleasures We have given certain classes of them, nor grieve over them, but lower your wing [in humility] to the believers.

arabic_text: وَقُلۡ إِنِّيٓ أَنَا ٱلنَّذِيرُ ٱلۡمُبِينُ

translations.english_saheeh: And say, "Indeed, I am the clear warner" -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And say (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه و سلم): "I am indeed a plain warner."
translations.english_rwwad: And say, “I am indeed a clear warner.” –

arabic_text: كَمَآ أَنزَلۡنَا عَلَى ٱلۡمُقۡتَسِمِينَ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [685]- Those who separated from the teachings of their prophets.  Another meaning is "As We sent down [punishment] on the sworn opponents [to Allāh's message]."

translations.english_saheeh: Just as We had revealed [scriptures] to the separators[685]
translations.english_hilali_khan: As We have sent down on the dividers, (Quraish pagans or Jews and Christians).
translations.english_rwwad: just as We sent down [punishment] upon those who divided [their religion],

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ جَعَلُواْ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ عِضِينَ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [686]- Accepting part and rejecting part according to their own inclinations.

translations.english_saheeh: Who have made the Qur’ān into portions.[686]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Who have made the Qur’ân into parts. (i.e. believed in one part and disbelieved in the other). [Tafsir At-Tabari]
translations.english_rwwad: those who split the Qur’an into different portions.

arabic_text: فَوَرَبِّكَ لَنَسۡـَٔلَنَّهُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: So by your Lord, We will surely question them all
translations.english_hilali_khan: So, by your Lord (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه و سلم), We shall certainly call all of them to account.
translations.english_rwwad: By your Lord, We will surely question them all

arabic_text: عَمَّا كَانُواْ يَعۡمَلُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: About what they used to do.
translations.english_hilali_khan: For all that they used to do.
translations.english_rwwad: concerning what they used to do.

arabic_text: فَٱصۡدَعۡ بِمَا تُؤۡمَرُ وَأَعۡرِضۡ عَنِ ٱلۡمُشۡرِكِينَ

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[687]- The implication is "Thereby you will distinguish or separate the disbelievers from the believers."
[688]- Any who persist in association of others with Allāh.

translations.english_saheeh: Then declare what you are commanded[687] and turn away from the polytheists.[688]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Therefore proclaim openly (Allâh’s Message - Islâmic Monotheism) that which you are commanded, and turn away from Al-Mushrikûn (polytheists, idolaters, and disbelievers - See V.2:105).
translations.english_rwwad: Then proclaim what you are commanded, and turn away from those who associate partners with Allah.

arabic_text: إِنَّا كَفَيۡنَٰكَ ٱلۡمُسۡتَهۡزِءِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We are sufficient for you against the mockers
translations.english_hilali_khan: Truly! We will suffice you against the scoffers,
translations.english_rwwad: We will surely suffice you against the mockers,

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ يَجۡعَلُونَ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَۚ فَسَوۡفَ يَعۡلَمُونَ
phonetic: 15.96 Al-Ladhīna Yaj`alūna Ma`a Allāhi 'Ilahāan 'Ākhara Fasawfa Ya`lamūna

translations.english_saheeh: Who make [equal] with Allāh another deity. But they are going to know.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Who set up along with Allâh another ilâh (god); but they will come to know.
translations.english_rwwad: those who set up besides Allah another god; they will come to know.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ نَعۡلَمُ أَنَّكَ يَضِيقُ صَدۡرُكَ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ
phonetic: 15.97 Wa Laqad Na`lamu 'Annaka Yađīqu Şadruka Bimā Yaqūlūna

translations.english_saheeh: And We already know that your breast is constrained by what they say.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Indeed, We know that your breast is straitened at what they say.
translations.english_rwwad: We know that you are distressed by what they say.

arabic_text: فَسَبِّحۡ بِحَمۡدِ رَبِّكَ وَكُن مِّنَ ٱلسَّٰجِدِينَ
phonetic: 15.98 Fasabbiĥ Biĥamdi Rabbika Wa Kun Mina As-Sājidīna

footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.15:98).
a) Narrated Abu Ma‘bad, the freed slave of Ibn ‘Abbâs: Ibn ‘Abbâs رضي الله عنهما told me, "In the lifetime of the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم , it was the custom to remember Allâh (Dhikr) by glorifying, praising and magnifying Allâh aloud after the compulsory congregational prayers." Ibn ‘Abbâs further said, "When I heard the (Dhikr), I would learn that the compulsory congregational prayer had ended." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.1, Hadîth No.802).
b) Narrated Ibn ‘Abbâs رضي الله عنهما: I used to recognize the completion of the prayer of the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم by hearing Takbîr (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.1, Hadith No.803).

translations.english_saheeh: So exalt [Allāh] with praise of your Lord and be of those who prostrate [to Him].
translations.english_hilali_khan: So glorify the praises of your Lord and be of those who prostrate themselves (to Him).[1]
translations.english_rwwad: Glorify your Lord with praise and be among those who prostrate [to Him],

arabic_text: وَٱعۡبُدۡ رَبَّكَ حَتَّىٰ يَأۡتِيَكَ ٱلۡيَقِينُ
phonetic: 15.99 Wa A`bud Rabbaka Ĥattá Ya'tiyaka Al-Yaqīnu

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.15:99) Narrated Anas رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "None of you should long for death because of a calamity that had befallen him; and if he cannot, but long for death, then he should say, ‘O Allâh! Let me live as long as life is better for me, and take my life if death is better for me’" (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.8, Hadith No.362).

translations.english_saheeh: And worship your Lord until there comes to you the certainty [i.e., death].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And worship your Lord until there comes unto you the certainty (i.e. death).[2]
translations.english_rwwad: and worship your Lord until the certainty [of death] comes to you.
